data.name: Number of Participants based on your percentile
data.description:
A percentile is a statistic measure, mostly used for comparisons. In a competition beeing in the 80 percentile means you are better than 80% of the participants.

Given your percentile(s) calculate the minimum number of participants. 
You would be given a list of percentiles which shows you your performance within the competition in different tasks. 

## Formula:
`percentile = participants_you_are_better_against / all_participants * 100`


## Examples
```
min_participants( [80] ) == 5
min_participants( [80, 70] ) == 10
min_participants( [80, 70, 95] ) == 20
min_participants( [12.5] ) == 8
min_participants( [12.5, 10] ) == 40

```
____

- All percentiles will be in the range from 0.0% to 100.0%
- All values will be floats with maximal 5 relevant digits after the decimal point
- The list will have at least one value
